remarks: If the (to be thought of as disjoint, although the proof does not require this) union of a set and its Hartogs number supports a group structure (more generally, a cancellative magma), then the set must be numerable.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 9-Jul-2015.)
statement: isnumbasgrplem2 $p |- ( ( S u. ( har ` S ) ) e. ( Base " Grp ) -> S e. dom card ) $.
